bookinfo.title: BIND 10 Messages Manual

abstract.para: BIND 10 is a Domain Name System (DNS) suite managed by Internet Systems Consortium (ISC). It includes DNS libraries and modular components for controlling authoritative and recursive DNS servers.
This is the messages manual for BIND 10 version &__VERSION__;. The most up-to-date version of this document, along with other documents for BIND 10, can be found at .

bookinfo.releaseinfo: This is the messages manual for BIND 10 version &__VERSION__;.

chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: This document lists each message that can be logged by the programs in the BIND 10 package. Each entry in this manual is of the form: IDENTIFICATION message-text ... where "IDENTIFICATION" is the message identification included in each message logged and "message-text" is the accompanying message text. The "message-text" may include placeholders of the form "%1", "%2" etc.; these parameters are replaced by relevant values when the message is logged.
Each entry is also accompanied by a description giving more information about the circumstances that result in the message being logged.
For information on configuring and using BIND 10 logging, refer to the BIND 10 Guide.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_FD_ADD_TCP adding a new TCP server by opened fd %1

listitem.para: A debug message informing about installing a file descriptor as a server. The file descriptor number is noted.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_FD_ADD_UDP adding a new UDP server by opened fd %1

listitem.para: A debug message informing about installing a file descriptor as a server. The file descriptor number is noted.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_FETCH_COMPLETED upstream fetch to %1(%2) has now completed

listitem.para: A debug message, this records that the upstream fetch (a query made by the resolver on behalf of its client) to the specified address has completed.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_FETCH_STOPPED upstream fetch to %1(%2) has been stopped

listitem.para: An external component has requested the halting of an upstream fetch. This is an allowed operation, and the message should only appear if debug is enabled.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_OPEN_SOCKET error %1 opening %2 socket to %3(%4)

listitem.para: The asynchronous I/O code encountered an error when trying to open a socket of the specified protocol in order to send a message to the target address. The number of the system error that caused the problem is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_READ_DATA error %1 reading %2 data from %3(%4)

listitem.para: The asynchronous I/O code encountered an error when trying to read data from the specified address on the given protocol. The number of the system error that caused the problem is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_READ_TIMEOUT receive timeout while waiting for data from %1(%2)

listitem.para: An upstream fetch from the specified address timed out. This may happen for any number of reasons and is most probably a problem at the remote server or a problem on the network. The message will only appear if debug is enabled.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_SEND_DATA error %1 sending data using %2 to %3(%4)

listitem.para: The asynchronous I/O code encountered an error when trying to send data to the specified address on the given protocol. The number of the system error that caused the problem is given in the message.

varlistentry.term: ASIODNS_UNKNOWN_ORIGIN unknown origin for ASIO error code %1 (protocol: %2, address %3)
ASIODNS_UNKNOWN_RESULT unknown result (%1) when IOFetch::stop() was executed for I/O to %2(%3)

listitem.para: An internal error indicating that the termination method of the resolver's upstream fetch class was called with an unknown result code (which is given in the message). Please submit a bug report.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_AXFR_ERROR error handling AXFR request: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message produced by the authoritative server when it has encountered an error processing an AXFR request. The message gives the reason for the error, and the server will return a SERVFAIL code to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_AXFR_UDP AXFR query received over UDP

listitem.para: This is a debug message output when the authoritative server has received an AXFR query over UDP. Use of UDP for AXFRs is not permitted by the protocol, so the server will return a FORMERR error to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_COMMAND_FAILED execution of command channel instruction '%1' failed: %2

listitem.para: Execution of the specified command by the authoritative server failed. The message contains the reason for the failure.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_CHANNEL_CREATED configuration session channel created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that authoritative server has created the channel to the configuration manager. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_CHANNEL_ESTABLISHED configuration session channel established

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that authoritative server has established communication the configuration manager over the previously-created channel. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_CHANNEL_STARTED configuration session channel started

listitem.para: This is a debug message, issued when the authoritative server has posted a request to be notified when new configuration information is available. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_LOAD_FAIL load of configuration failed: %1

listitem.para: An attempt to configure the server with information from the configuration database during the startup sequence has failed. (The reason for the failure is given in the message.) The server will continue its initialization although it may not be configured in the desired way.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_CONFIG_UPDATE_FAIL update of configuration failed: %1

listitem.para: At attempt to update the configuration the server with information from the configuration database has failed, the reason being given in the message.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_DATA_SOURCE data source database file: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message produced by the authoritative server when it accesses a datebase data source, listing the file that is being accessed.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_DNS_SERVICES_CREATED DNS services created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the component that will handling incoming queries for the authoritative server (DNSServices) has been successfully created. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_HEADER_PARSE_FAIL unable to parse header in received DNS packet: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to parse the header of a received DNS packet has failed. (The reason for the failure is given in the message.) The server will drop the packet.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_INVALID_STATISTICS_DATA invalid specification of statistics data specified

listitem.para: An error was encountered when the authoritiative server specified statistics data which is invalid for the auth specification file.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_LOAD_TSIG loading TSIG keys

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has requested the keyring holding TSIG keys from the configuration database. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_LOAD_ZONE loaded zone %1/%2

listitem.para: This debug message is issued during the processing of the 'loadzone' command when the authoritative server has successfully loaded the named zone of the named class.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_MEM_DATASRC_DISABLED memory data source is disabled for class %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message reporting that the authoritative server has discovered that the memory data source is disabled for the given class.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_MEM_DATASRC_ENABLED memory data source is enabled for class %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message reporting that the authoritative server has discovered that the memory data source is enabled for the given class.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_MESSAGE_FORWARD_ERROR failed to forward %1 request from %2: %3

listitem.para: The authoritative server tried to forward some type DNS request message to a separate process (e.g., forwarding dynamic update requests to b10-ddns) to handle it, but it failed. The authoritative server returns SERVFAIL to the client on behalf of the separate process. The error could be configuration mismatch between b10-auth and the recipient component, or it may be because the requests are coming too fast and the receipient process cannot keep up with the rate, or some system level failure. In either case this means the BIND 10 system is not working as expected, so the administrator should look into the cause and address the issue. The log message includes the client's address (and port), and the error message sent from the lower layer that detects the failure.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NOTIFY_QUESTIONS invalid number of questions (%1) in incoming NOTIFY

listitem.para: This debug message is logged by the authoritative server when it receives a NOTIFY packet that contains zero or more than one question. (A valid NOTIFY packet contains one question.) The server will return a FORMERR error to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NOTIFY_RRTYPE invalid question RR type (%1) in incoming NOTIFY

listitem.para: This debug message is logged by the authoritative server when it receives a NOTIFY packet that an RR type of something other than SOA in the question section. (The RR type received is included in the message.) The server will return a FORMERR error to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_NO_XFRIN received NOTIFY but XFRIN session is not running

listitem.para: This is a debug message produced by the authoritative server when it receives a NOTIFY packet but the XFRIN process is not running. The packet will be dropped and nothing returned to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PACKET_PARSE_ERROR unable to parse received DNS packet: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to parse a received DNS packet has failed due to something other than a protocol error. The reason for the failure is given in the message; the server will return a SERVFAIL error code to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PACKET_PROTOCOL_ERROR DNS packet protocol error: %1. Returning %2

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to parse a received DNS packet has failed due to a protocol error. The reason for the failure is given in the message, as is the error code that will be returned to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PACKET_RECEIVED message received:\n%1

listitem.para: This is a debug message output by the authoritative server when it receives a valid DNS packet.

Note: This message includes the packet received, rendered in the form of multiple lines of text. For this reason, it is suggested that this log message not be routed to the syslog file, where the multiple lines could confuse programs that expect a format of one message per line.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_PROCESS_FAIL message processing failure: %1

listitem.para: This message is generated by the authoritative server when it has encountered an internal error whilst processing a received packet: the cause of the error is included in the message.
The server will return a SERVFAIL error code to the sender of the packet. This message indicates a potential error in the server. Please open a bug ticket for this issue.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RECEIVED_COMMAND command '%1' received

listitem.para: This is a debug message issued when the authoritative server has received a command on the command channel.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RECEIVED_NOTIFY received incoming NOTIFY for zone name %1, zone class %2

listitem.para: This is a debug message reporting that an incoming NOTIFY was received.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RESPONSE_FAILURE exception while building response to query: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, generated by the authoritative server when an attempt to create a response to a received DNS packet has failed. The reason for the failure is given in the log message. A SERVFAIL response is sent back. The most likely cause of this is an error in the data source implementation; it is either creating bad responses or raising exceptions itself.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RESPONSE_FAILURE_UNKNOWN unknown exception while building response to query

listitem.para: This debug message is similar to AUTH_RESPONSE_FAILURE, but further details about the error are unknown, because it was signaled by something which is not an exception. This is definitely a bug.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_RESPONSE_RECEIVED received response message, ignoring

listitem.para: This is a debug message, this is output if the authoritative server receives a DNS packet with the QR bit set, i.e. a DNS response. The server ignores the packet as it only responds to question packets.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SEND_ERROR_RESPONSE sending an error response (%1 bytes):\n%2

listitem.para: This is a debug message recording that the authoritative server is sending an error response to the originator of the query. A previous message will have recorded details of the failure.

Note: This message includes the packet sent, rendered in the form of multiple lines of text. For this reason, it is suggested that this log message not be routed to the syslog file, where the multiple lines could confuse programs that expect a format of one message per line.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SEND_NORMAL_RESPONSE sending a normal response (%1 bytes):\n%2

listitem.para: This is a debug message recording that the authoritative server is sending a response to the originator of a query.

Note: This message includes the packet sent, rendered in the form of multiple lines of text. For this reason, it is suggested that this log message not be routed to the syslog file, where the multiple lines could confuse programs that expect a format of one message per line.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SERVER_CREATED server created

listitem.para: An informational message indicating that the authoritative server process has been created and is initializing. The AUTH_SERVER_STARTED message will be output when initialization has successfully completed and the server starts accepting queries.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SERVER_FAILED server failed: %1

listitem.para: The authoritative server has encountered a fatal error and is terminating. The reason for the failure is included in the message.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SERVER_STARTED server started

listitem.para: Initialization of the authoritative server has completed successfully and it is entering the main loop, waiting for queries to arrive.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SHUTDOWN asked to stop, doing so

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating the server was asked to shut down and it is complying to the request.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_SQLITE3 nothing to do for loading sqlite3

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has found that the data source it is loading is an SQLite3 data source, so no further validation is needed.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_START_DDNS_FORWARDER DDNS UPDATE handling started

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that b10-auth has received a message that it should internally forward UPDATE message to b10-ddns. When b10-ddns is not running, b10-auth will respond to UPDATE requests with rcode NOTIMP. When b10-ddns is running, b10-ddns will handle and respond to the UPDATE message.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_STOP_DDNS_FORWARDER DDNS UPDATE handling stopped

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that b10-auth has received a message that it should stop internally forwarding UPDATE message to b10-ddns. b10-auth will no longer forward UPDATE messages to b10-ddns, but will respond itself with error code NOTIMP. This message is also logged when the forwarding is restarted (for instance if b10-ddns is restarted and the internal connection needs to be created again), in which case it should be followed by AUTH_START_DDNS_FORWARDER.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_UNSUPPORTED_OPCODE unsupported opcode: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message, produced when a received DNS packet being processed by the authoritative server has been found to contain an unsupported opcode. (The opcode is included in the message.) The server will return an error code of NOTIMPL to the sender.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_XFRIN_CHANNEL_CREATED XFRIN session channel created

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has created a channel to the XFRIN (Transfer-in) process. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_XFRIN_CHANNEL_ESTABLISHED XFRIN session channel established

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the authoritative server has established communication over the previously-created channel to the XFRIN (Transfer-in) process. It is issued during server startup is an indication that the initialization is proceeding normally.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_ZONEMGR_COMMS error communicating with zone manager: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message output during the processing of a NOTIFY request. An error (listed in the message) has been encountered whilst communicating with the zone manager. The NOTIFY request will not be honored.

varlistentry.term: AUTH_ZONEMGR_ERROR received error response from zone manager: %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message output during the processing of a NOTIFY request. The zone manager component has been informed of the request, but has returned an error response (which is included in the message). The NOTIFY request will not be honored.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CHECK_MSGQ_ALREADY_RUNNING checking if msgq is already running

listitem.para: The boss process is starting up and will now check if the message bus daemon is already running. If so, it will not be able to start, as it needs a dedicated message bus.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_COMPONENT_FAILED component %1 (pid %2) failed: %3

listitem.para: The process terminated, but the bind10 boss didn't expect it to, which means it must have failed.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_COMPONENT_RESTART component %1 is about to restart

listitem.para: The named component failed previously and we will try to restart it to provide as flawless service as possible, but it should be investigated what happened, as it could happen again.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_COMPONENT_START component %1 is starting

listitem.para: The named component is about to be started by the boss process.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_COMPONENT_START_EXCEPTION component %1 failed to start: %2

listitem.para: An exception (mentioned in the message) happened during the startup of the named component. The componet is not considered started and further actions will be taken about it.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_COMPONENT_STOP component %1 is being stopped

listitem.para: A component is about to be asked to stop willingly by the boss.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_COMPONENT_UNSATISFIED component %1 is required to run and failed

listitem.para: A component failed for some reason (see previous messages). It is either a core component or needed component that was just started. In any case, the system can't continue without it and will terminate.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_BUILD building plan '%1' -> '%2'

listitem.para: A debug message. This indicates that the configurator is building a plan how to change configuration from the older one to newer one. This does no real work yet, it just does the planning what needs to be done.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_PLAN_INTERRUPTED configurator plan interrupted, only %1 of %2 done

listitem.para: There was an exception during some planned task. The plan will not continue and only some tasks of the plan were completed. The rest is aborted. The exception will be propagated.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_RECONFIGURE reconfiguring running components

listitem.para: A different configuration of which components should be running is being installed. All components that are no longer needed will be stopped and newly introduced ones started. This happens at startup, when the configuration is read the first time, or when an operator changes configuration of the boss.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_RUN running plan of %1 tasks

listitem.para: A debug message. The configurator is about to execute a plan of actions it computed previously.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_START bind10 component configurator is starting up

listitem.para: The part that cares about starting and stopping the right component from the boss process is starting up. This happens only once at the startup of the boss process. It will start the basic set of processes now (the ones boss needs to read the configuration), the rest will be started after the configuration is known.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_STOP bind10 component configurator is shutting down

listitem.para: The part that cares about starting and stopping processes in the boss is shutting down. All started components will be shut down now (more precisely, asked to terminate by their own, if they fail to comply, other parts of the boss process will try to force them).

varlistentry.term: BIND10_CONFIGURATOR_TASK performing task %1 on %2

listitem.para: A debug message. The configurator is about to perform one task of the plan it is currently executing on the named component.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_INVALID_STATISTICS_DATA invalid specification of statistics data specified

listitem.para: An error was encountered when the boss module specified statistics data which is invalid for the boss specification file.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_INVALID_USER invalid user: %1

listitem.para: The boss process was started with the -u option, to drop root privileges and continue running as the specified user, but the user is unknown.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_KILLING_ALL_PROCESSES killing all started processes

listitem.para: The boss module was not able to start every process it needed to start during startup, and will now kill the processes that did get started.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_KILL_PROCESS killing process %1

listitem.para: The boss module is sending a kill signal to process with the given name, as part of the process of killing all started processes during a failed startup, as described for BIND10_KILLING_ALL_PROCESSES

varlistentry.term: BIND10_LOST_SOCKET_CONSUMER consumer %1 of sockets disconnected, considering all its sockets closed

listitem.para: A connection from one of the applications which requested a socket was closed. This means the application has terminated, so all the sockets it was using are now closed and bind10 process can release them as well, unless the same sockets are used by yet another application.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_MSGQ_ALREADY_RUNNING msgq daemon already running, cannot start

listitem.para: There already appears to be a message bus daemon running. Either an old process was not shut down correctly, and needs to be killed, or another instance of BIND10, with the same msgq domain socket, is running, which needs to be stopped.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_MSGQ_DISAPPEARED msgq channel disappeared

listitem.para: While listening on the message bus channel for messages, it suddenly disappeared. The msgq daemon may have died. This might lead to an inconsistent state of the system, and BIND 10 will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_NO_SOCKET couldn't send a socket for token %1 because of error: %2

listitem.para: An error occurred when the bind10 process was asked to send a socket file descriptor. The error is mentioned, most common reason is that the request is invalid and may not come from bind10 process at all.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_PROCESS_ENDED process %2 of %1 ended with status %3

listitem.para: This indicates a process started previously terminated. The process id and component owning the process are indicated, as well as the exit code. This doesn't distinguish if the process was supposed to terminate or not.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_READING_BOSS_CONFIGURATION reading boss configuration

listitem.para: The boss process is starting up, and will now process the initial configuration, as received from the configuration manager.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_RECEIVED_COMMAND received command: %1

listitem.para: The boss module received a command and shall now process it. The command is printed.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_RECEIVED_NEW_CONFIGURATION received new configuration: %1

listitem.para: The boss module received a configuration update and is going to apply it now. The new configuration is printed.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_RECEIVED_SIGNAL received signal %1

listitem.para: The boss module received the given signal.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_RESURRECTED_PROCESS resurrected %1 (PID %2)

listitem.para: The given process has been restarted successfully, and is now running with the given process id.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_RESURRECTING_PROCESS resurrecting dead %1 process...

listitem.para: The given process has ended unexpectedly, and is now restarted.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SELECT_ERROR error in select() call: %1

listitem.para: There was a fatal error in the call to select(), used to see if a child process has ended or if there is a message on the message bus. This should not happen under normal circumstances and is considered fatal, so BIND 10 will now shut down. The specific error is printed.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SEND_SIGKILL sending SIGKILL to %1 (PID %2)

listitem.para: The boss module is sending a SIGKILL signal to the given process.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SEND_SIGTERM sending SIGTERM to %1 (PID %2)

listitem.para: The boss module is sending a SIGTERM signal to the given process.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SETGID setting GID to %1

listitem.para: The boss switches the process group ID to the given value. This happens when BIND 10 starts with the -u option, and the group ID will be set to that of the specified user.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SETUID setting UID to %1

listitem.para: The boss switches the user it runs as to the given UID.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SHUTDOWN stopping the server

listitem.para: The boss process received a command or signal telling it to shut down. It will send a shutdown command to each process. The processes that do not shut down will then receive a SIGTERM signal. If that doesn't work, it shall send SIGKILL signals to the processes still alive.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SHUTDOWN_COMPLETE all processes ended, shutdown complete

listitem.para: All child processes have been stopped, and the boss process will now stop itself.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_BAD_CAUSE unknown error cause from socket creator: %1

listitem.para: The socket creator reported an error when creating a socket. But the function which failed is unknown (not one of 'S' for socket or 'B' for bind).

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_BAD_RESPONSE unknown response for socket request: %1

listitem.para: The boss requested a socket from the creator, but the answer is unknown. This looks like a programmer error.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_EOF eof while expecting data from socket creator

listitem.para: There should be more data from the socket creator, but it closed the socket. It probably crashed.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_INIT initializing socket creator parser

listitem.para: The boss module initializes routines for parsing the socket creator protocol.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_KILL killing the socket creator

listitem.para: The socket creator is being terminated the aggressive way, by sending it sigkill. This should not happen usually.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_TERMINATE terminating socket creator

listitem.para: The boss module sends a request to terminate to the socket creator.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKCREATOR_TRANSPORT_ERROR transport error when talking to the socket creator: %1

listitem.para: Either sending or receiving data from the socket creator failed with the given error. The creator probably crashed or some serious OS-level problem happened, as the communication happens only on local host.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKET_CREATED successfully created socket %1

listitem.para: The socket creator successfully created and sent a requested socket, it has the given file number.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKET_ERROR error on %1 call in the creator: %2/%3

listitem.para: The socket creator failed to create the requested socket. It failed on the indicated OS API function with given error.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_SOCKET_GET requesting socket [%1]:%2 of type %3 from the creator

listitem.para: The boss forwards a request for a socket to the socket creator.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTED_CC started configuration/command session

listitem.para: Debug message given when BIND 10 has successfull started the object that handles configuration and commands.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTED_PROCESS started %1

listitem.para: The given process has successfully been started.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTED_PROCESS_PID started %1 (PID %2)

listitem.para: The given process has successfully been started, and has the given PID.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTING starting BIND10: %1

listitem.para: Informational message on startup that shows the full version.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTING_CC starting configuration/command session

listitem.para: Informational message given when BIND 10 is starting the session object that handles configuration and commands.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTING_PROCESS starting process %1

listitem.para: The boss module is starting the given process.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTING_PROCESS_PORT starting process %1 (to listen on port %2)

listitem.para: The boss module is starting the given process, which will listen on the given port number.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTING_PROCESS_PORT_ADDRESS starting process %1 (to listen on %2#%3)

listitem.para: The boss module is starting the given process, which will listen on the given address and port number (written as <address>#<port>).

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTUP_COMPLETE BIND 10 started

listitem.para: All modules have been successfully started, and BIND 10 is now running.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTUP_ERROR error during startup: %1

listitem.para: There was a fatal error when BIND10 was trying to start. The error is shown, and BIND10 will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTUP_UNEXPECTED_MESSAGE unrecognised startup message %1

listitem.para: During the startup process, a number of messages are exchanged between the Boss process and the processes it starts. This error is output when a message received by the Boss process is recognised as being of the correct format but is unexpected. It may be that processes are starting of sequence.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STARTUP_UNRECOGNISED_MESSAGE unrecognised startup message %1

listitem.para: During the startup process, a number of messages are exchanged between the Boss process and the processes it starts. This error is output when a message received by the Boss process is not recognised.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_START_AS_NON_ROOT_AUTH starting b10-auth as a user, not root. This might fail.

listitem.para: The authoritative server is being started or restarted without root privileges. If the module needs these privileges, it may have problems starting. Note that this issue should be resolved by the pending 'socket-creator' process; once that has been implemented, modules should not need root privileges anymore. See tickets #800 and #801 for more information.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_START_AS_NON_ROOT_RESOLVER starting b10-resolver as a user, not root. This might fail.

listitem.para: The resolver is being started or restarted without root privileges. If the module needs these privileges, it may have problems starting. Note that this issue should be resolved by the pending 'socket-creator' process; once that has been implemented, modules should not need root privileges anymore. See tickets #800 and #801 for more information.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_STOP_PROCESS asking %1 to shut down

listitem.para: The boss module is sending a shutdown command to the given module over the message channel.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_UNKNOWN_CHILD_PROCESS_ENDED unknown child pid %1 exited

listitem.para: An unknown child process has exited. The PID is printed, but no further action will be taken by the boss process.

varlistentry.term: BIND10_WAIT_CFGMGR waiting for configuration manager process to initialize

listitem.para: The configuration manager process is so critical to operation of BIND 10 that after starting it, the Boss module will wait for it to initialize itself before continuing. This debug message is produced during the wait and may be output zero or more times depending on how long it takes the configuration manager to start up. The total length of time Boss will wait for the configuration manager before reporting an error is set with the command line --wait switch, which has a default value of ten seconds.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_ENTRY_MISSING_RRSET missing RRset to generate message for %1

listitem.para: The cache tried to generate the complete answer message. It knows the structure of the message, but some of the RRsets to be put there are not in cache (they probably expired already). Therefore it pretends the message was not found.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_LOCALZONE_FOUND found entry with key %1 in local zone data

listitem.para: Debug message, noting that the requested data was successfully found in the local zone data of the cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_LOCALZONE_UNKNOWN entry with key %1 not found in local zone data

listitem.para: Debug message. The requested data was not found in the local zone data.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_LOCALZONE_UPDATE updating local zone element at key %1

listitem.para: Debug message issued when there's update to the local zone section of cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_DEINIT deinitialized message cache

listitem.para: Debug message. It is issued when the server deinitializes the message cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_EXPIRED found an expired message entry for %1 in the message cache

listitem.para: Debug message. The requested data was found in the message cache, but it already expired. Therefore the cache removes the entry and pretends it found nothing.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_FOUND found a message entry for %1 in the message cache

listitem.para: Debug message. We found the whole message in the cache, so it can be returned to user without any other lookups.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_INIT initialized message cache for %1 messages of class %2

listitem.para: Debug message issued when a new message cache is issued. It lists the class of messages it can hold and the maximum size of the cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_REMOVE removing old instance of %1/%2/%3 first

listitem.para: Debug message. This may follow CACHE_MESSAGES_UPDATE and indicates that, while updating, the old instance is being removed prior of inserting a new one.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_UNCACHEABLE not inserting uncacheable message %1/%2/%3

listitem.para: Debug message, noting that the given message can not be cached. This is because there's no SOA record in the message. See RFC 2308 section 5 for more information.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_UNKNOWN no entry for %1 found in the message cache

listitem.para: Debug message. The message cache didn't find any entry for the given key.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_MESSAGES_UPDATE updating message entry %1/%2/%3

listitem.para: Debug message issued when the message cache is being updated with a new message. Either the old instance is removed or, if none is found, new one is created.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_DEEPEST looking up deepest NS for %1/%2

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver cache is looking up the deepest known nameserver, so the resolution doesn't have to start from the root.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_INIT initializing resolver cache for class %1

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver cache is being created for this given class.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_INIT_INFO initializing resolver cache for class %1

listitem.para: Debug message, the resolver cache is being created for this given class. The difference from CACHE_RESOLVER_INIT is only in different format of passed information, otherwise it does the same.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_LOCAL_MSG message for %1/%2 found in local zone data

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver cache found a complete message for the user query in the zone data.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_LOCAL_RRSET RRset for %1/%2 found in local zone data

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver cache found a requested RRset in the local zone data.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_LOOKUP_MSG looking up message in resolver cache for %1/%2

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver cache is trying to find a message to answer the user query.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_LOOKUP_RRSET looking up RRset in resolver cache for %1/%2

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver cache is trying to find an RRset (which usually originates as internally from resolver).

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_NO_QUESTION answer message for %1/%2 has empty question section

listitem.para: The cache tried to fill in found data into the response message. But it discovered the message contains no question section, which is invalid. This is likely a programmer error, please submit a bug report.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_UNKNOWN_CLASS_MSG no cache for class %1

listitem.para: Debug message. While trying to lookup a message in the resolver cache, it was discovered there's no cache for this class at all. Therefore no message is found.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_UNKNOWN_CLASS_RRSET no cache for class %1

listitem.para: Debug message. While trying to lookup an RRset in the resolver cache, it was discovered there's no cache for this class at all. Therefore no data is found.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_UPDATE_MSG updating message for %1/%2/%3

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver is updating a message in the cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_UPDATE_RRSET updating RRset for %1/%2/%3

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver is updating an RRset in the cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_UPDATE_UNKNOWN_CLASS_MSG no cache for class %1

listitem.para: Debug message. While trying to insert a message into the cache, it was discovered that there's no cache for the class of message. Therefore the message will not be cached.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RESOLVER_UPDATE_UNKNOWN_CLASS_RRSET no cache for class %1

listitem.para: Debug message. While trying to insert an RRset into the cache, it was discovered that there's no cache for the class of the RRset. Therefore the message will not be cached.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_EXPIRED found expired RRset %1/%2/%3

listitem.para: Debug message. The requested data was found in the RRset cache. However, it is expired, so the cache removed it and is going to pretend nothing was found.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_INIT initializing RRset cache for %1 RRsets of class %2

listitem.para: Debug message. The RRset cache to hold at most this many RRsets for the given class is being created.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_LOOKUP looking up %1/%2/%3 in RRset cache

listitem.para: Debug message. The resolver is trying to look up data in the RRset cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_NOT_FOUND no RRset found for %1/%2/%3 in cache

listitem.para: Debug message which can follow CACHE_RRSET_LOOKUP. This means the data is not in the cache.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_REMOVE_OLD removing old RRset for %1/%2/%3 to make space for new one

listitem.para: Debug message which can follow CACHE_RRSET_UPDATE. During the update, the cache removed an old instance of the RRset to replace it with the new one.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_UNTRUSTED not replacing old RRset for %1/%2/%3, it has higher trust level

listitem.para: Debug message which can follow CACHE_RRSET_UPDATE. The cache already holds the same RRset, but from more trusted source, so the old one is kept and new one ignored.

varlistentry.term: CACHE_RRSET_UPDATE updating RRset %1/%2/%3 in the cache

listitem.para: Debug message. The RRset is updating its data with this given RRset.

varlistentry.term: CC_ASYNC_READ_FAILED asynchronous read failed (error code = %1)

listitem.para: This marks a low level error, we tried to read data from the message queue daemon asynchronously, but the ASIO library returned an error.

varlistentry.term: CC_CONN_ERROR error connecting to message queue (%1)

listitem.para: It is impossible to reach the message queue daemon for the reason given. It is unlikely there'll be reason for whatever program this currently is to continue running, as the communication with the rest of BIND 10 is vital for the components.

varlistentry.term: CC_DISCONNECT disconnecting from message queue daemon

listitem.para: The library is disconnecting from the message queue daemon. This debug message indicates that the program is trying to shut down gracefully.

varlistentry.term: CC_ESTABLISH trying to establish connection with message queue daemon at %1

listitem.para: This debug message indicates that the command channel library is about to connect to the message queue daemon, which should be listening on the UNIX-domain socket listed in the output.

varlistentry.term: CC_ESTABLISHED successfully connected to message queue daemon

listitem.para: This debug message indicates that the connection was successfully made, this should follow CC_ESTABLISH.

varlistentry.term: CC_GROUP_RECEIVE trying to receive a message

listitem.para: Debug message, noting that a message is expected to come over the command channel.

varlistentry.term: CC_GROUP_RECEIVED message arrived ('%1', '%2')

listitem.para: Debug message, noting that we successfully received a message (its envelope and payload listed). This follows CC_GROUP_RECEIVE, but might happen some time later, depending if we waited for it or just polled.

varlistentry.term: CC_GROUP_SEND sending message '%1' to group '%2'

listitem.para: Debug message, we're about to send a message over the command channel.

varlistentry.term: CC_INVALID_LENGTHS invalid length parameters (%1, %2)

listitem.para: This happens when garbage comes over the command channel or some kind of confusion happens in the program. The data received from the socket make no sense if we interpret it as lengths of message. The first one is total length of the message; the second is the length of the header. The header and its length (2 bytes) is counted in the total length.

varlistentry.term: CC_LENGTH_NOT_READY length not ready

listitem.para: There should be data representing the length of message on the socket, but it is not there.

varlistentry.term: CC_NO_MESSAGE no message ready to be received yet

listitem.para: The program polled for incoming messages, but there was no message waiting. This is a debug message which may happen only after CC_GROUP_RECEIVE.

varlistentry.term: CC_NO_MSGQ unable to connect to message queue (%1)

listitem.para: It isn't possible to connect to the message queue daemon, for reason listed. It is unlikely any program will be able continue without the communication.

varlistentry.term: CC_READ_ERROR error reading data from command channel (%1)

listitem.para: A low level error happened when the library tried to read data from the command channel socket. The reason is listed.

varlistentry.term: CC_READ_EXCEPTION error reading data from command channel (%1)

listitem.para: We received an exception while trying to read data from the command channel socket. The reason is listed.

varlistentry.term: CC_REPLY replying to message from '%1' with '%2'

listitem.para: Debug message, noting we're sending a response to the original message with the given envelope.

varlistentry.term: CC_SET_TIMEOUT setting timeout to %1ms

listitem.para: Debug message. A timeout for which the program is willing to wait for a reply is being set.

varlistentry.term: CC_START_READ starting asynchronous read

listitem.para: Debug message. From now on, when a message (or command) comes, it'll wake the program and the library will automatically pass it over to correct place.

varlistentry.term: CC_SUBSCRIBE subscribing to communication group %1

listitem.para: Debug message. The program wants to receive messages addressed to this group.

varlistentry.term: CC_TIMEOUT timeout reading data from command channel

listitem.para: The program waited too long for data from the command channel (usually when it sent a query to different program and it didn't answer for whatever reason).

varlistentry.term: CC_UNSUBSCRIBE unsubscribing from communication group %1

listitem.para: Debug message. The program no longer wants to receive messages addressed to this group.

varlistentry.term: CC_WRITE_ERROR error writing data to command channel (%1)

listitem.para: A low level error happened when the library tried to write data to the command channel socket.

varlistentry.term: CC_ZERO_LENGTH invalid message length (0)

listitem.para: The library received a message length being zero, which makes no sense, since all messages must contain at least the envelope.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_AUTOMATIC_CONFIG_DATABASE_UPDATE Updating configuration database from version %1 to %2

listitem.para: An older version of the configuration database has been found, from which there was an automatic upgrade path to the current version. These changes are now applied, and no action from the administrator is necessary.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_BACKED_UP_CONFIG_FILE Config file %1 was removed; a backup was made at %2

listitem.para: BIND 10 has been started with the command to clear the configuration file. The existing file has been backed up (moved) to the given file name. A new configuration file will be created in the original location when necessary.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_BAD_UPDATE_RESPONSE_FROM_MODULE Unable to parse response from module %1: %2

listitem.para: The configuration manager sent a configuration update to a module, but the module responded with an answer that could not be parsed. The answer message appears to be invalid JSON data, or not decodable to a string. This is likely to be a problem in the module in question. The update is assumed to have failed, and will not be stored.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_CC_SESSION_ERROR Error connecting to command channel: %1

listitem.para: The configuration manager daemon was unable to connect to the messaging system. The most likely cause is that msgq is not running.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_CONFIG_FILE Configuration manager starting with configuration file: %1

listitem.para: The configuration manager is starting, reading and saving the configuration settings to the shown file.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_DATA_READ_ERROR error reading configuration database from disk: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem reading the persistent configuration data as stored on disk. The file may be corrupted, or it is of a version from where there is no automatic upgrade path. The file needs to be repaired or removed. The configuration manager daemon will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_IOERROR_WHILE_WRITING_CONFIGURATION Unable to write configuration file; configuration not stored: %1

listitem.para: There was an IO error from the system while the configuration manager was trying to write the configuration database to disk. The specific error is given. The most likely cause is that the directory where the file is stored does not exist, or is not writable. The updated configuration is not stored.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_OSERROR_WHILE_WRITING_CONFIGURATION Unable to write configuration file; configuration not stored: %1

listitem.para: There was an OS error from the system while the configuration manager was trying to write the configuration database to disk. The specific error is given. The most likely cause is that the system does not have write access to the configuration database file. The updated configuration is not stored.

varlistentry.term: CFGMGR_STOPPED_BY_KEYBOARD keyboard interrupt, shutting down

listitem.para: There was a keyboard interrupt signal to stop the cfgmgr daemon. The daemon will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_BAD_CONFIG_DATA error in config data: %1

listitem.para: There was an error reading the updated configuration data. The specific error is printed.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_BAD_PASSWORD bad password for user: %1

listitem.para: A login attempt was made to b10-cmdctl, but the password was wrong. Users can be managed with the tool b10-cmdctl-usermgr.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_CC_SESSION_ERROR error reading from cc channel: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem reading from the command and control channel. The most likely cause is that the message bus daemon is not running.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_CC_SESSION_TIMEOUT timeout on cc channel

listitem.para: A timeout occurred when waiting for essential data from the cc session. This usually occurs when b10-cfgmgr is not running or not responding. Since we are waiting for essential information, this is a fatal error, and the cmdctl daemon will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_COMMAND_ERROR error in command %1 to module %2: %3

listitem.para: An error was encountered sending the given command to the given module. Either there was a communication problem with the module, or the module was not able to process the command, and sent back an error. The specific error is printed in the message.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_COMMAND_SENT command '%1' to module '%2' was sent

listitem.para: This debug message indicates that the given command has been sent to the given module.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_NO_SUCH_USER username not found in user database: %1

listitem.para: A login attempt was made to b10-cmdctl, but the username was not known. Users can be added with the tool b10-cmdctl-usermgr.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_NO_USER_ENTRIES_READ failed to read user information, all users will be denied

listitem.para: The b10-cmdctl daemon was unable to find any user data in the user database file. Either it was unable to read the file (in which case this message follows a message CMDCTL_USER_DATABASE_READ_ERROR containing a specific error), or the file was empty. Users can be added with the tool b10-cmdctl-usermgr.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_SEND_COMMAND sending command %1 to module %2

listitem.para: This debug message indicates that the given command is being sent to the given module.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_SSL_SETUP_FAILURE_USER_DENIED failed to create an SSL connection (user denied): %1

listitem.para: The user was denied because the SSL connection could not successfully be set up. The specific error is given in the log message. Possible causes may be that the ssl request itself was bad, or the local key or certificate file could not be read.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_STARTED cmdctl is listening for connections on %1:%2

listitem.para: The cmdctl daemon has started and is now listening for connections.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_STOPPED_BY_KEYBOARD keyboard interrupt, shutting down

listitem.para: There was a keyboard interrupt signal to stop the cmdctl daemon. The daemon will now shut down.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTION uncaught exception: %1

listitem.para: The b10-cmdctl daemon encountered an uncaught exception and will now shut down. This is indicative of a programming error and should not happen under normal circumstances. The exception message is printed.

varlistentry.term: CMDCTL_USER_DATABASE_READ_ERROR failed to read user database file %1: %2

listitem.para: The b10-cmdctl daemon was unable to read the user database file. The file may be unreadable for the daemon, or it may be corrupted. In the latter case, it can be recreated with b10-cmdctl-usermgr. The specific error is printed in the log message.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_CCSESSION_MSG error in CC session message: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem with an incoming message on the command and control channel. The message does not appear to be a valid command, and is missing a required element or contains an unknown data format. This most likely means that another BIND10 module is sending a bad message. The message itself is ignored by this module.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_CCSESSION_MSG_INTERNAL error handling CC session message: %1

listitem.para: There was an internal problem handling an incoming message on the command and control channel. An unexpected exception was thrown, details of which are appended to the message. The module will continue to run, but will not send back an answer.
The most likely cause of this error is a programming error. Please raise a bug report.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_CCSESSION_STOPPING error sending stopping message: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem when sending a message signaling that the module using this CCSession is stopping. This message is sent so that the rest of the system is aware that the module is no longer running. Apart from logging this message, the error itself is ignored, and the ModuleCCSession is still stopped. The specific exception message is printed.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_CCSESSION_STOPPING_UNKNOWN unknown error sending stopping message

listitem.para: Similar to CONFIG_CCSESSION_STOPPING, but in this case the exception that is seen is not a standard exception, and further information is unknown. This is a bug.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_GET_FAIL error getting configuration from cfgmgr: %1

listitem.para: The configuration manager returned an error when this module requested the configuration. The full error message answer from the configuration manager is appended to the log error. The most likely cause is that the module is of a different (command specification) version than the running configuration manager.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_GET_FAILED error getting configuration from cfgmgr: %1

listitem.para: The configuration manager returned an error response when the module requested its configuration. The full error message answer from the configuration manager is appended to the log error.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_JSON_PARSE JSON parse error in %1: %2

listitem.para: There was an error parsing the JSON file. The given file does not appear to be in valid JSON format. Please verify that the filename is correct and that the contents are valid JSON.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_LOG_CONFIG_ERRORS error(s) in logging configuration: %1

listitem.para: There was a logging configuration update, but the internal validator for logging configuration found that it contained errors. The errors are shown, and the update is ignored.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_LOG_EXPLICIT will use logging configuration for explicitly-named logger %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message. When processing the "loggers" part of the configuration file, the configuration library found an entry for the named logger that matches the logger specification for the program. The logging configuration for the program will be updated with the information.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_LOG_IGNORE_EXPLICIT ignoring logging configuration for explicitly-named logger %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message. When processing the "loggers" part of the configuration file, the configuration library found an entry for the named logger. As this does not match the logger specification for the program, it has been ignored.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_LOG_IGNORE_WILD ignoring logging configuration for wildcard logger %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message. When processing the "loggers" part of the configuration file, the configuration library found the named wildcard entry (one containing the "*" character) that matched a logger already matched by an explicitly named entry. The configuration is ignored.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_LOG_WILD_MATCH will use logging configuration for wildcard logger %1

listitem.para: This is a debug message. When processing the "loggers" part of the configuration file, the configuration library found the named wildcard entry (one containing the "*" character) that matches a logger specification in the program. The logging configuration for the program will be updated with the information.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_MOD_SPEC_FORMAT module specification error in %1: %2

listitem.para: The given file does not appear to be a valid specification file: details are included in the message. Please verify that the filename is correct and that its contents are a valid BIND10 module specification.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_MOD_SPEC_REJECT module specification rejected by cfgmgr: %1

listitem.para: The specification file for this module was rejected by the configuration manager. The full error message answer from the configuration manager is appended to the log error. The most likely cause is that the module is of a different (specification file) version than the running configuration manager.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_OPEN_FAIL error opening %1: %2

listitem.para: There was an error opening the given file. The reason for the failure is included in the message.

varlistentry.term: CONFIG_SESSION_STOPPING_FAILED error sending stopping message: %1

listitem.para: There was a problem when sending a message signaling that the module using this CCSession is stopping. This message is sent so that the rest of the system is aware that the module is no longer running. Apart from logging this message, the error itself is ignored, and the ModuleCCSession is still stopped. The specific exception message is printed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_BAD_NSEC3_NAME NSEC3 record has a bad owner name '%1'

listitem.para: The software refuses to load NSEC3 records into a wildcard domain or the owner name has two or more labels below the zone origin. It isn't explicitly forbidden, but no sane zone wouldn have such names for NSEC3. BIND 9 also refuses NSEC3 at wildcard, so this behavior is compatible with BIND 9.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_CREATE creating the hotspot cache

listitem.para: This is a debug message issued during startup when the hotspot cache is created.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_DESTROY destroying the hotspot cache

listitem.para: Debug information. The hotspot cache is being destroyed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_DISABLE disabling the hotspot cache

listitem.para: A debug message issued when the hotspot cache is disabled.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_ENABLE enabling the hotspot cache

listitem.para: A debug message issued when the hotspot cache is enabled.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_EXPIRED item '%1' in the hotspot cache has expired

listitem.para: A debug message issued when a hotspot cache lookup located the item but it had expired. The item was removed and the program proceeded as if the item had not been found.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_FOUND the item '%1' was found

listitem.para: Debug information. An item was successfully located in the hotspot cache.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_FULL hotspot cache is full, dropping oldest

listitem.para: Debug information. After inserting an item into the hotspot cache, the maximum number of items was exceeded, so the least recently used item will be dropped. This should be directly followed by CACHE_REMOVE.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_INSERT inserting item '%1' into the hotspot cache

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a new item is being inserted into the hotspot cache.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_NOT_FOUND the item '%1' was not found in the hotspot cache

listitem.para: A debug message issued when hotspot cache was searched for the specified item but it was not found.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_OLD_FOUND older instance of hotspot cache item '%1' found, replacing

listitem.para: Debug information. While inserting an item into the hotspot cache, an older instance of an item with the same name was found; the old instance will be removed. This will be directly followed by CACHE_REMOVE.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_REMOVE removing '%1' from the hotspot cache

listitem.para: Debug information. An item is being removed from the hotspot cache.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_CACHE_SLOTS setting the hotspot cache size to '%1', dropping '%2' items

listitem.para: The maximum allowed number of items of the hotspot cache is set to the given number. If there are too many, some of them will be dropped. The size of 0 means no limit.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_COVER_NSEC_UNSUPPORTED %1 doesn't support DNSSEC when asked for NSEC data covering %2

listitem.para: The datasource tried to provide an NSEC proof that the named domain does not exist, but the database backend doesn't support DNSSEC. No proof is included in the answer as a result.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FINDNSEC3 Looking for NSEC3 for %1 in %2 mode

listitem.para: Debug information. A search in an database data source for NSEC3 that matches or covers the given name is being started.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FINDNSEC3_COVER found a covering NSEC3 for %1 at label count %2: %3

listitem.para: Debug information. An NSEC3 that covers the given name is found and being returned. The found NSEC3 RRset is also displayed. When the shown label count is smaller than that of the given name, the matching NSEC3 is for a superdomain of the given name (see DATASRC_DATABSE_FINDNSEC3_TRYHASH). The found NSEC3 RRset is also displayed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FINDNSEC3_MATCH found a matching NSEC3 for %1 at label count %2: %3

listitem.para: Debug information. An NSEC3 that matches (a possibly superdomain of) the given name is found and being returned. When the shown label count is smaller than that of the given name, the matching NSEC3 is for a superdomain of the given name (see DATASRC_DATABSE_FINDNSEC3_TRYHASH). The found NSEC3 RRset is also displayed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FINDNSEC3_TRYHASH looking for NSEC3 for %1 at label count %2 (hash %3)

listitem.para: Debug information. In an attempt of finding an NSEC3 for the give name, (a possibly superdomain of) the name is hashed and searched for in the NSEC3 name space. When the shown label count is smaller than that of the shown name, the search tries the superdomain name that share the shown (higher) label count of the shown name (e.g., for www.example.com. with shown label count of 3, example.com. is being tried, as "." is 1 label long).

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FINDNSEC3_TRYHASH_PREV looking for previous NSEC3 for %1 at label count %2 (hash %3)

listitem.para: Debug information. An exact match on hash (see DATASRC_DATABASE_FINDNSEC3_TRYHASH) was unsuccessful. We get the previous hash to that one instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FIND_RECORDS looking in datasource %1 for record %2/%3/%4

listitem.para: Debug information. The database data source is looking up records with the given name and type in the database.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FIND_TTL_MISMATCH TTL values differ in %1 for elements of %2/%3/%4, setting to %5

listitem.para: The datasource backend provided resource records for the given RRset with different TTL values. This isn't allowed on the wire and is considered an error, so we set it to the lowest value we found (but we don't modify the database). The data in database should be checked and fixed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_ANY search in datasource %1 resulted in returning all records of %2

listitem.para: The data returned by the database backend contained data for the given domain name, so all the RRsets of the domain are returned.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_CNAME search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 found CNAME, resulting in %5

listitem.para: When searching the domain for a name a CNAME was found at that name. Even though it was not the RR type being sought, it is returned. (The caller may want to continue the lookup by replacing the query name with the canonical name and restarting the query with the original RR type.)

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_DELEGATION Found delegation at %2 in %1

listitem.para: When searching for a domain, the program met a delegation to a different zone at the given domain name. It will return that one instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_DELEGATION_EXACT search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 found delegation at %5

listitem.para: The program found the domain requested, but it is a delegation point to a different zone, therefore it is not authoritative for this domain name. It will return the NS record instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_DNAME Found DNAME at %2 in %1

listitem.para: When searching for a domain, the program met a DNAME redirection to a different place in the domain space at the given domain name. It will return that one instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_EMPTY_NONTERMINAL empty non-terminal %2 in %1

listitem.para: The domain name does not have any RRs associated with it, so it doesn't exist in the database. However, it has a subdomain, so it does exist in the DNS address space. This type of domain is known an an "empty non-terminal" and so we return NXRRSET instead of NXDOMAIN.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_NXDOMAIN search in datasource %1 resulted in NXDOMAIN for %2/%3/%4

listitem.para: The data returned by the database backend did not contain any data for the given domain name, class and type.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_NXRRSET search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 resulted in NXRRSET

listitem.para: The data returned by the database backend contained data for the given domain name and class, but not for the given type.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_NXRRSET_NSEC search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 resulted in RRset %5

listitem.para: A search in the database for RRs for the specified name, type and class has located RRs that match the name and class but not the type. DNSSEC information has been requested and returned.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_FOUND_RRSET search in datasource %1 resulted in RRset %2

listitem.para: The data returned by the database backend contained data for the given domain name, and it either matches the type or has a relevant type. The RRset that is returned is printed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_ITERATE iterating zone %1

listitem.para: The program is reading the whole zone, eg. not searching for data, but going through each of the RRsets there.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_ITERATE_END iterating zone finished

listitem.para: While iterating through the zone, the program reached end of the data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_ITERATE_NEXT next RRset in zone is %1/%2

listitem.para: While iterating through the zone, the program extracted next RRset from it. The name and RRtype of the RRset is indicated in the message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_ITERATE_TTL_MISMATCH TTL values differ for RRs of %1/%2/%3, setting to %4

listitem.para: While iterating through the zone, the time to live for RRs of the given RRset were found to be different. Since an RRset cannot have multiple TTLs, we set it to the lowest value we found (but we don't modify the database). This is what the client would do when such RRs were given in a DNS response according to RFC2181. The data in database should be checked and fixed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_JOURNALREADER_END %1/%2 on %3 from %4 to %5

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the program (successfully) reaches the end of sequences of a zone's differences. The zone's name and class, database name, and the start and end serials are shown in the message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_JOURNALREADER_NEXT %1/%2 in %3/%4 on %5

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the program retrieves one difference in difference sequences of a zone and successfully converts it to an RRset. The zone's name and class, database name, and the name and RR type of the retrieved diff are shown in the message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_JOURNALREADER_START %1/%2 on %3 from %4 to %5

listitem.para: This is a debug message indicating that the program starts reading a zone's difference sequences from a database-based data source. The zone's name and class, database name, and the start and end serials are shown in the message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_JOURNALREADR_BADDATA failed to convert a diff to RRset in %1/%2 on %3 between %4 and %5: %6

listitem.para: This is an error message indicating that a zone's diff is broken and the data source library failed to convert it to a valid RRset. The most likely cause of this is that someone has manually modified the zone's diff in the database and inserted invalid data as a result. The zone's name and class, database name, and the start and end serials, and an additional detail of the error are shown in the message. The administrator should examine the diff in the database to find any invalid data and fix it.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_NO_MATCH not match for %2/%3/%4 in %1

listitem.para: No match (not even a wildcard) was found in the named data source for the given name/type/class in the data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_UPDATER_COMMIT updates committed for '%1/%2' on %3

listitem.para: Debug information. A set of updates to a zone has been successfully committed to the corresponding database backend. The zone name, its class and the database name are printed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_UPDATER_CREATED zone updater created for '%1/%2' on %3

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone updater object is created to make updates to the shown zone on the shown backend database.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_UPDATER_DESTROYED zone updater destroyed for '%1/%2' on %3

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone updater object is destroyed, either successfully or after failure of, making updates to the shown zone on the shown backend database.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_UPDATER_ROLLBACK zone updates roll-backed for '%1/%2' on %3

listitem.para: A zone updater is being destroyed without committing the changes. This would typically mean the update attempt was aborted due to some error, but may also be a bug of the application that forgets committing the changes. The intermediate changes made through the updater won't be applied to the underlying database. The zone name, its class, and the underlying database name are shown in the log message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_UPDATER_ROLLBACKFAIL failed to roll back zone updates for '%1/%2' on %3: %4

listitem.para: A zone updater is being destroyed without committing the changes to the database, and attempts to rollback incomplete updates, but it unexpectedly fails. The higher level implementation does not expect it to fail, so this means either a serious operational error in the underlying data source (such as a system failure of a database) or software bug in the underlying data source implementation. In either case if this message is logged the administrator should carefully examine the underlying data source to see what exactly happens and whether the data is still valid. The zone name, its class, and the underlying database name as well as the error message thrown from the database module are shown in the log message.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_ANY search in datasource %1 resulted in wildcard match type ANY on %2

listitem.para: The database doesn't contain directly matching name. When searching for a wildcard match, a wildcard record matching the name of the query containing some RRsets was found. All the RRsets of the node are returned.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_CANCEL_NS canceled wildcard match on %3 because %2 contains NS (data source %1)

listitem.para: The database was queried to provide glue data and it didn't find direct match. It could create it from given wildcard, but matching wildcards is forbidden under a zone cut, which was found. Therefore the delegation will be returned instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_CANCEL_SUB wildcard %2 can't be used to construct %3 because %4 exists in %1

listitem.para: The answer could be constructed using the wildcard, but the given subdomain exists, therefore this name is something like empty non-terminal (actually, from the protocol point of view, it is empty non-terminal, but the code discovers it differently).

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_CNAME search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 found wildcard CNAME at %5, resulting in %6

listitem.para: The database doesn't contain directly matching name. When searching for a wildcard match, a CNAME RR was found at a wildcard record matching the name. This is returned as the result of the search.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_EMPTY found subdomains of %2 which is a wildcard match for %3 in %1

listitem.para: The given wildcard matches the name being sough but it as an empty nonterminal (e.g. there's nothing at *.example.com but something like subdomain.*.example.org, do exist: so *.example.org exists in the namespace but has no RRs assopciated with it). This will produce NXRRSET.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_MATCH search in datasource %1 resulted in wildcard match at %2 with RRset %3

listitem.para: The database doesn't contain directly matching name. When searching for a wildcard match, a wildcard record matching the name and type of the query was found. The data at this point is returned.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_NS search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 found wildcard delegation at %5, resulting in %6

listitem.para: The database doesn't contain directly matching name. When searching for a wildcard match, an NS RR was found at a wildcard record matching the name. This is returned as the result of the search.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DATABASE_WILDCARD_NXRRSET search in datasource %1 for %2/%3/%4 resulted in wildcard NXRRSET at %5

listitem.para: The database doesn't contain directly matching name. When searching for a wildcard match, a matching wildcard entry was found but it did not contain RRs the requested type. AN NXRRSET indication is returned.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_DO_QUERY handling query for '%1/%2'

listitem.para: A debug message indicating that a query for the given name and RR type is being processed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_LIST_NOT_CACHED zone %1/%2 not cached, cache disabled globally. Will not be available.

listitem.para: The process disabled caching of RR data completely. However, the given zone is provided as a master file and it can be served from memory cache only. Therefore, the zone will not be available for this process. If this is a problem, you should move the zone to some database backend (sqlite3, for example) and use it from there.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MASTERLOAD_ERROR %1

listitem.para: An error was found in the zone data for a MasterFiles zone. The zone is not loaded. The specific error is shown in the message, and should be addressed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ADD_RRSET adding RRset '%1/%2' into zone '%3'

listitem.para: Debug information. An RRset is being added to the in-memory data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ADD_WILDCARD adding wildcards for '%1'

listitem.para: This is a debug message issued during the processing of a wildcard name. The internal domain name tree is scanned and some nodes are specially marked to allow the wildcard lookup to succeed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ADD_ZONE adding zone '%1/%2'

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone is being added into the in-memory data source.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_ANY_SUCCESS ANY query for '%1' successful

listitem.para: Debug information. The domain was found and an ANY type query is being answered by providing everything found inside the domain.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CNAME CNAME at the domain '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested domain is an alias to a different domain, returning the CNAME instead.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CNAME_COEXIST can't add data to CNAME in domain '%1'

listitem.para: This is the same problem as in MEM_CNAME_TO_NONEMPTY, but it happened the other way around -- adding some other data to CNAME.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CNAME_TO_NONEMPTY can't add CNAME to domain with other data in '%1'

listitem.para: Someone or something tried to add a CNAME into a domain that already contains some other data. But the protocol forbids coexistence of CNAME with anything (RFC 1034, section 3.6.2). This indicates a problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_CREATE creating zone '%1' in '%2' class

listitem.para: Debug information. A representation of a zone for the in-memory data source is being created.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DELEG_FOUND delegation found at '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A delegation point was found above the requested record.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DESTROY destroying zone '%1' in '%2' class

listitem.para: Debug information. A zone from in-memory data source is being destroyed.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DNAME_ENCOUNTERED encountered a DNAME

listitem.para: Debug information. While searching for the requested domain, a DNAME was encountered on the way. This may lead to redirection to a different domain and stop the search.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DNAME_FOUND DNAME found at '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. A DNAME was found instead of the requested information.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DNAME_NS DNAME and NS can't coexist in non-apex domain '%1'

listitem.para: A request was made for DNAME and NS records to be put into the same domain which is not the apex (the top of the zone). This is forbidden by RFC 2672 (section 3) and indicates a problem with provided data.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DOMAIN_EMPTY requested domain '%1' is empty

listitem.para: Debug information. The requested domain exists in the tree of domains, but it is empty. Therefore it doesn't contain the requested resource type.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_DUP_RRSET duplicate RRset '%1/%2'

listitem.para: An RRset is being inserted into in-memory data source for a second time. The original version must be removed first. Note that loading master files where an RRset is split into multiple locations is not supported yet.

varlistentry.term: DATASRC_MEM_EXACT_DELEGATION delegation at the exact domain '%1'

listitem.para: Debug information. There's a NS record at the requested domain. This means this zone is not authoritative for the requested domain, but a delegation should be followed. The requested domain is an apex of some zone.
